name: State_14

timeline_beats.label: Joined Coastal Defense Compact after raider surge

factions.label: Maritime Guilds
factions.influence_hint: Controls ports, shipbuilding, trade routes; dominant in coastal towns

factions.label: Saltbaron Houses
factions.influence_hint: Landed elites owning saltworks and estuary farmlands; regional political sway

factions.label: Tide-Scriptoria
factions.influence_hint: Ritual navigators and augury houses; gatekeepers of navigational auguries

factions.label: Dockworkers' Syndicate
factions.influence_hint: Labour force in ports; organizes strikes, controls loading/processing

constraints: No instant resurrection or true life-replacement magics allowed
Long-range mind influence rare and institutionally banned within polity
Navigational auguries permitted but cannot replace charts/seamanship
Ritual magic heavily dependent on scarce imported reagents or specialized labour
Combustion-derived industry limited (no high-pressure steam megatechs)
Must honor interstate alliances/treaties listed in external_relations_refs
notes: Ritual reagent supply lines are strategic vulnerabilities for commerce and auguries
Guild charters and harbour maps are primary administrative records
Seasonal monsoon/ice cycles dictate fishing and trade peaks; adaptations embedded in law
Saltworks and port access create intra-state fault lines between coast and estuary elites
Lower layers should map major ports, guild centers, and reagent import routes
